com.epeterso2.jabberwordy.serialization.puz
Class PUZUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.epeterso2.jabberwordy.serialization.puz.PUZUtil

public abstract class PUZUtil
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of utility methods and constants for reading and writing PUZ images in byte[] format

These routines are used by the PUZPuzzleInputStream and PUZPuzzleOutputStream classes for their heavy lifting. If all you need to do is to convert a PUZ file to or from a PUZPuzzle object, use those classes instead.

This class provides static methods that operate on PUZ images stored in byte[] format. The methods of this class are stateless and nondestructive to the image.

Two-byte numeric values stored in a PUZ image in little-endian format. All values are unsigned. Methods of this class that return unsigned byte and unsigned short values do so by storing them in int objects. This class contains convenience methods to convert between int, unsigned byte, and unsigned short values.

The solution and player state cells in a PUZ image are arranged as bytes in row-first order. The routines of this class assume that the leftmost column index and the topmost row index are 0.

This class was designed for ease-of-use in understanding and accuracy in reading/writing the PUZ file format. As a result, performance was traded for readability. Since puzzle files tend to be small, this lack of efficiency is generally not noticeable when running on a desktop computer, but it may be a cause for concern when running on a cell phone or other mobile device.

Author:
Eric Peterson
See Also:
The PUZ File Format

                                  int start,
                                  int length)

Parameters:
image - The byte[] image
start - The starting position of the region
length - The length of the region
Returns:
The computed checksum for the region

computeChecksum

public static int computeChecksum(byte[] image,
                                  int start,
                                  int length,
                                  int checksum)
Calculate the checksum for a given region of an image using the given initial checksum value. The checksum is a variant of CRC-16.

Parameters:
image - The byte[] image
start - The starting position of the region
length - The length of the region
checksum - The initial value of the checksum
Returns:
The computed checksum for the region
See Also:
PUZ file format checksums

Return an unsigned short value in an int as a 2-element array of unsigned bytes in little-endian format

Parameters:
i - The integer to convert
Returns:
A byte[] of unsigned byte values (byte 0 is the least significant, byte 1 is most significant)

getString

public static java.lang.String getString(byte[] image,
                                         int index)
Return the string stored in a PUZ image that corresponds to the given index. The strings are stored beginning immediately after the solution and player state sections, and each string is null terminated. Some strings have fixed indices (such as STRING_AUTHOR, STRING_COPYRIGHT, STRING_TITLE, and STRING_FIRST_CLUE). After the last clue string is the Notepad string.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
index - The index number of the string to retrieve
Returns:
The string at the given index

                                         int index)
Return the starting position of a string stored within a PUZ image

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
index - The index of the string whose start position will be found
Returns:
The start position of the indexed string

The offset of the start of the string section

getNumberOfCells

public static int getNumberOfCells(byte[] image)
Return the total number of cells in the grid stored within a PUZ image. This is equal to the product of the width and height stored in the image.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
Returns:
The number of cells in the image

public static PUZExtraSection getExtraSection(byte[] image,
                                              java.lang.String title)
Return a PUZExtraSection with a given title stored in a PUZ image. If no section with that title is found in the image, null is returned.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
title - The title of the extra section to find
Returns:
The extra section with the given title, or null if not found

Return a List of all clues stored within a PUZ image

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
Returns:
A List of clues stored within the image. The index of each clue in the list corresponds to the index number used by the getClue(byte[], int) method.

isValidImage

public static boolean isValidImage(byte[] image)
Determine if a given image is a valid PUZ file image. The FILE_MAGIC string, overall file checksum, CIB checksum, masked checksums, and extra section checksums are all computed and compared to the values found in the PUZ image.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
Returns:
True if all tests pass and checksums match, false otherwise

public static boolean isDiagramless(byte[] image)
Determine if a PUZ image is for a diagramless puzzle or not.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
Returns:
True if the image is for a diagramless puzzle, false if for a normal puzzle

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
Returns:
True if the puzzle solution is encrypted, false if not

getSolution

public static PUZSolution getSolution(byte[] image,
                                      int col,
                                      int row)
Return the solution for a given cell in a PUZ image. If there is a rebus entry for the cell in the GRBS/RTBL extra sections, then the rebus value is returned. Otherwise, the value of the normal solution cell is returned.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
col - The column (starting at 0) of the desired cell
row - The row (starting at 0) of the desired cell
Returns:
The value of the solution for the desired cell

isBlock

public static boolean isBlock(byte[] image,
                              int col,
                              int row)
Determines if a specific cell in a PUZ image is playable by the solver, meaning that the solver can enter a value. A nonplayable cell is a black square or block.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
col - The column (starting at 0) of the desired cell
row - The row (starting at 0) of the desired cell
Returns:
True if the cell is playable by the solver, false if it is a block.

                                              int col,
                                              int row)

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
col - The column (starting at 0) of the desired cell
row - The row (starting at 0) of the desired cell
Returns:
The value of the player state for the desired cell

getUnlockCode

public static java.lang.String getUnlockCode(byte[] image)
Determines the solution unlock code for a PUZ image if the solution is encrypted. The solution is found by brute-force searching of all 6,561 possible unlock codes until a working one is found by comparing the checksum of the unlocked solution to the decrypted solution checksum stored in the image. If one does exist, it will be a 4-digit number that does not use zero (0) as a digit. This method will only find the code, it will not unlock the solution. The PUZEncryption class is used to perform the unlocking.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
Returns:
The unlock code, or null if the code cannot be determined or if there is no unlock code

unlockSolution

public static void unlockSolution(byte[] image,
                                  java.lang.String unlockCode)
Unlock the solution of a PUZ image using the given unlock code. The unlock code is not checked against the decrypted checksum stored elsewhere in the PUZ image; this method simply decrypts the solution using the given code. This method does perform destructive modification to the PUZ image - when it returns, the solution is unlocked and the cleartext is stored in the solution space of the image.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
unlockCode - The unlock code to use. This must be a 4-digit number whose digits do not include zero (0).

lockSolution

public static void lockSolution(byte[] image,
                                java.lang.String unlockCode)
Lock the solution of a PUZ image using the given unlock code. The decrypted checksum stored elsewhere in the PUZ image is not computed nor modified; this method simply encrypts the solution using the given code. This method does perform destructive modification to the PUZ image - when it returns, the solution is locked and the encryption solution is stored in the solution space of the image.

Parameters:
image - The PUZ image
unlockCode - The unlock code to use. This must be a 4-digit number whose digits do not include zero (0).

                                   int col,
                                   int row,
                                   byte b)

Parameters:

b - The value to which to set the solution cell

                             int toOffset,
                             int size)

size - The size of the region to copy

                             byte[] toImage,
                             int size)

fromImage - The source image
toImage - The destination image
size - The size of the region to copy
